title: Promoting the Use of Trustworthy Artificial Intelligence in the Federal Government

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to use artificial intelligence (AI) responsibly, promoting innovation while ensuring public trust, privacy, and civil rights are protected. It sets clear principles for how AI should be used in government operations and establishes processes for oversight, coordination, and workforce development related to AI.
potential_concerns: The deployment of AI in federal government decision-making may unintentionally perpetuate or exacerbate biases affecting individuals-with-disabilities and racial-ethnic-minorities despite principles aiming to protect civil rights.
Technology-workers in federal agencies might face challenges adapting to new AI oversight and monitoring responsibilities without sufficient training or workforce development resources.
Working-age adults who rely on federal services could experience negative impacts if AI applications lack transparency or result in inaccurate or unfair decisions, undermining public trust.

Interagency coordination efforts may struggle to implement consistent AI governance, potentially causing uneven application of the orderâ€™s principles and resulting in disparities affecting vulnerable populations.
